features.title: A starter baseline you can build on
features.description: This repo is intentionally small: a handful of reusable sections driven by two config files.

items.title: Section toggles + reorderable layout
items.description: Each section has an `enabled` flag, so you can remove or rearrange without rebuilding a design system.

items.title: Motion that respects users
items.description: Animations are subtle and honor `prefers-reduced-motion` (Framer Motion is optional to remove).

items.title: Optional 3D (lazy + isolated)
items.description: The WebGL scene is deferred, lazy-loaded, and has a static fallback. Keep it, tweak it, or delete it.

items.title: Accessible defaults
items.description: Semantic landmarks, skip link, and focus-visible styles out of the box.

items.title: Boring build output
items.description: Static build via `npm run build` — deploy to any static host.

howItWorks.title: A repeatable workflow for new projects
howItWorks.description: Update the config, swap the copy, and ship. Keep the structure predictable so you can focus on visuals and message.

steps.title: Set the site
steps.description: Update name, links, theme colors, and meta in `src/config/site.ts` (or run `npm run init`).

steps.title: Swap the copy
steps.description: Edit `src/config/content.ts` (features, steps, FAQ, testimonials, etc.). Keep it honest and editable.

steps.title: Deploy anywhere
steps.description: Run `npm run build` and upload the `dist/` folder to Netlify (or any static host).

faq.title: FAQ
faq.description: Keep it short. Link out to docs when needed.

items.question: Where do I customize the brand?
items.answer: Edit `src/config/site.ts`. It controls name, links, brand colors/gradients/fonts, and SEO defaults (and you can regenerate via `npm run init`).

items.question: Does it support reduced motion?
items.answer: Yes. Motion respects user settings, and the 3D ornament can disable when `prefers-reduced-motion` is enabled.

items.question: Is the 3D required?
items.answer: No. It’s lazy-loaded, deferred, and has a static fallback. You can also disable it in `src/config/site.ts`.

items.question: How do I deploy to Netlify?
items.answer: Build with `npm run build`, set the publish directory to `dist`, and you’re done. No server required.

cta.title: Make it yours
cta.description: Run the init script, edit the two config files, then replace assets (favicon/OG image) when you’re ready.
